page.title: 05HOLME QUARRY
page.content: HOLME QUARRY HAS BEEN OPEN FOR ABOUT 100 YEARS.FOR 50 YEARS THEY HAD BEEN BURNING LIME STONE TO MAKE PLASTER FOR BUILDING AND DRESSING STONES FOR BUILDING HOUSES. THEY BURNED THE LIME IN THE KILN WITH COKE AND COAL. ALL THE PLASTER AND STONE WAS TAKEN BY HORSE AND CART TO THE BUILDERS. AFTER THE WAR THEY WERE MECHANISED AND STARTED USING CRUSHERS AND DUMPERS. THEY STOPPED BURNING LIME BECAUSE THEY COULD GRIND IT.NOW THE STONE IS USED FOR CONCRETE AND ROADS AND THE LIME DUST IS FOR THE FARMERS TO PUT ON THE FIELDS AND FOR MAKING BRICKS AND BLOCKS FOR BUILDING.
